alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 06 at 3:36PM CDT until April 06 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR ALL OF THE OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND MOST OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ALL OF THE OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND MOST OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM to 9 PM CDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron...Texas and Beaver. In Texas...Dallam...Sherman...Hansford...Ochiltree...Lipscomb... Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson...Roberts...Hemphill...Potter... Carson...Gray...Wheeler...Randall...Armstrong...Donley... Collingsworth and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Northwest winds 25 to 39 mph with higher gusts both today and Thursday. The highest winds will be in the northeast Panhandles, and the lower winds will be in the southwest Panhandles. * Relative Humidity...As low as 7 to 11 percent today and 8 to 15 percent Thursday. The lowest RH values on Thursday are expected in the southeast Panhandles. * Red Flag Threat Index...7 to 8 today in the northern and eastern Panhandles with 3 to 6 in the southwest Panhandles. RFTI`s of 6 to 7 expected Thursday. * Timing...Through 9 PM CDT today and also 10 AM CDT through 9 PM CDT Thursday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
